17 class motor_controller:
18  def __init__(self) -> None:
19  # motor_controller initialization
20  rospy.init_node('motor_controller')
21  self.motorIDs = 1
22  rospy.loginfo('motor controller initialised')
23  # self.robot_joint_state = np.zeros(len(self.motorIDs))
24  self.pub_states = rospy.Publisher('motor_state/1',tmotor_cmd,queue_size=10)
25  self.pub_commands = rospy.Publisher('motor_command/1',tmotor_cmd,queue_size=10)
26 
27  self.sub_states = rospy.Subscriber('can_response/motor_'+str(self.motorIDs), tmotor_data, self.joint_state_callback, self.motorIDs)
28 
29  rospy.loginfo('publishers initialised')
30 
31  while self.pub_states.get_num_connections() == 0:
32  print("Establishing connection with...", self.motorIDs)
33  rospy.Rate(50).sleep()
34  pass
35 
36  def joint_state_callback(self, data, id):
37  if id == 1:
38  self.robot_joint_state = data.position
39 
40  def armMotor(self,idx):
41  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
42  cmd.status = True
43  cmd.setzero = False
44  cmd.position = 0
45  cmd.velocity = 0
46  cmd.torque = 0
47  cmd.kp = 0
48  cmd.kd = 0
49  self.pub_states.publish(cmd)
50  rospy.loginfo('motor armed')
51  time.sleep(0.3)
52 
53  def disarmMotor(self,idx):
54  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
55  cmd.status = False
56  cmd.setzero = False
57  cmd.position = 0
58  cmd.velocity = 0
59  cmd.torque = 0
60  cmd.kp = 0
61  cmd.kd = 0
62  self.pub_states.publish(cmd)
63  rospy.loginfo('motor disarmed')
64  time.sleep(0.3)
65 
66  def setZero(self, idx):
67  # not tested yet
68  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
69  cmd.status = True
70  cmd.setzero = True
71  cmd.position = 0
72  cmd.velocity = 0
73  cmd.torque = 0
74  cmd.kp = 0
75  cmd.kd = 0
76  self.pub_commands[idx].publish(cmd)
77 
78  def setAngle(self, idx, angle, kp, kd):
79  # !!! Since the motor command is now a different topic, we
80  # might want to use a different mesgs to set the control mode etc.
81  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
82  cmd.status = True
83  cmd.setzero = False
84  # The input angle is in degrees
85  cmd.position = angle
86  cmd.velocity = 0
87  cmd.torque = 0
88  # This ensures that we are in the position only mode
89  cmd.kp = kp # 20
90  cmd.kd = kd # 4
91  self.pub_commands.publish(cmd)
92  rospy.loginfo('Angle Set')
93  # time.sleep(0.1)
94 
95  def setCommand(self, idx, angle, velocity, kp, kd):
96  # !!! Since the motor command is now a different topic, we
97  # might want to use a different mesgs to set the control mode etc.
98  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
99  # The input angle is in degrees
100  cmd.position = angle
101  cmd.velocity = velocity
102  cmd.torque = 0
103  # This ensures that we are in the position only mode
104  cmd.kp = kp # 20
105  cmd.kd = kd # 4
106  self.pub_commands.publish(cmd)
107  rospy.loginfo('command sent')
108  # time.sleep(0.1)
109 
110  def setVelocity(self,idx,velocity,kd):
111  # this is the low level control command for velocity control
112  # the unit of velocity is degree/s
113  # 1 rpm = 6 degree/s
114  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
115  cmd.position = 0
116  cmd.velocity = velocity
117  cmd.torque = 0
118  cmd.kp = 0
119  cmd.kd = kd
120  self.pub_commands.publish(cmd)
121  rospy.loginfo('command sent')
122

124  # disarm twice to update the current joint position
125  # self.disarmAll()
126  # self.disarmAll()
127  # print the joint state
128  rospy.loginfo("{}".format(self.robot_joint_state))
129  print(self.robot_joint_state)
130 
131 if __name__ == '__main__':
132  original_sigint = signal.getsignal(signal.SIGINT)
133  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, exit_gracefully)
